headline.main: Early Cardiac Signs Found in Children of Younger Heart Patients

docs.lead_paragraph: Children of people who experience early onset of heart disease are much more likely to be obese and to develop other signs of future cardiovascular disease in early adulthood, research suggests. Obesity was significantly more prevalent in children as young as 5 whose parents had major heart problems by around the age of 50 than in children whose parents had healthy hearts, according to a study by researchers involved in the landmark Bogalusa Heart Study.
